subject: Communication
title: The Decoy Effect
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Decoy Effect.

hook.text: A movie theater offers small popcorn for $3 and large for $7. Nobody buys the large. Then they add medium.

buildup.text: The medium is $6.50 â€” almost as expensive as the large. Suddenly the large looks like a bargain.

discovery.text: The medium is the 'decoy' â€” it exists only to make the large seem like a better deal by comparison.

twist.text: Nobody needs to buy the decoy for it to work. Its mere presence shifts your preference to the target.

climax.text: The Economist used this with subscriptions: print-only ($125), digital ($59), print+digital ($125).

punchline.text: The option you'd never choose controls what you do.

quiz.question: What is the purpose of a 'decoy' option in pricing?
options: To make another option look like a better deal
